text: I love plant allies and how they can help us move through things. California poppy can soothe your nervous system. In the wake of a challenging situation, my emotions today were very weighty. I feel sad most of the day, and used the poppy tea for the first time this evening. I feel calm, gentle and at peace. Even a little fuzzy, which is not a great description for some people but it explains how I feel. The taste is somewhat grassy, and almost has a warm mouth feel (not like licorice root, way more subtle). I enjoyed it, and I’m enjoying the relaxing feeling of it now.

text: This is not a "loose leaf tea" as advertised but pieces of stems without a single leaf or flower.  I enclosed a photo of my old loose leaf ( almost finished) tea beside what I received from Nelson.  You can see for yourself.  Despite the evidence, the seller denied the deceitful advertisement and denied my returning his loose stems ( for obvious reason).  When a seller denies a return, the seller does not refund.  Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.
title: Not a loose leaf tea: see the difference on the photos leaf vs no leaf

text: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

text: I have used this as sleep enhancing remedy for several months and find it quite effective. I tried Californai Poppy capsules and they do not do the job. I take one dropper full  of this extract in a cup of chamomile tea about an hour before sleep. Straight chamomile does nothing. The poppy  seems to help me wake up on time and be more alert, not over sleep, so it may be helping the quality of  sleep. I dislike the high alcohol level and the taste is truly vile, that is the reason for four stars. Herb Pharm has proved to be a reliable company of quality extracts but they don't make California Poppy in a glycerin, non alcohol form. I still recommend this and suggest putting it in an herb tea to avoid the taste.

text: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.
title: Main Ingredient Wood Alcohol??

text: I saw the many positive reviews on here and read some various literature online touting the wonderful relaxing effects of California poppy extract. I ordered a bottle and I have to say it was a complete waste of money. It had a strong, bitter alcohol taste (considering it is mixed with alcohol) that was difficult to mask, even when I boiled it in water to boil off some of the alcohol and added it to my tea. Since I use herbal extracts to relax, I am always on the lookout for new, helpful herbal remedies. For instance, I find passionflower and valerian extracts to be very effective. After reading about California poppy being a relaxant, pain reliever, etc. I had pretty high expectations. I have to say I was disappointed. Only after taking twice the suggested dosage did I feel a little relaxed, and even so, it was nowhere near as effective as valerian or passionflower. I did not have any interesting or lucid dreams, and it did nothing for pain. I suppose it works for some people, but it definitely didn't do a thing for me.

name: California Poppy Tea Herb Organic 4 Ounce
description: This listing is for 1 - 4 ounce package of Organic California Poppy Herb. California Poppy Herb, or Eschscholzia californica, consists of the parts of the plant that grow above the ground, i.e., the leaves, stems and petals. These bulk herbs (which are really leaves and petals) are then dried and can be used as an infusion (as in tea) or an herbal tincture. A perennial native to the interior valleys of southern Oregon and California and ranging into the deserts of Nevada and Arizona, bulk California Poppy Herb has been used for several thousands of years by the Yokut and Pima Indians for its mildly sedative properties. Warning: Not to be used during pregnancy.

California Poppy Herb, or Eschscholzia californica, consists of the parts of the plant that grow above the ground, i.e., the leaves, stems and petals. text: I love plant allies and how they can help us move through things. California poppy can soothe your nervous system. In the wake of a challenging situation, my emotions today were very weighty. text: This is not a "loose leaf tea" as advertised but pieces of stems without a single leaf or flower.  I enclosed a photo of my old loose leaf ( almost finished) tea beside what I received from Nelson.  You can see for yourself.  Despite the evidence, the seller denied the deceitful advertisement and denied my returning his loose stems ( for obvious reason).  When a seller denies a return, the seller does not refund.  Amazon did reimburse me with their A to Z policy.  Be aware of this and try finding a real loose leaf tea of California Poppy.  It's a wonderful tea when the leaves are there.
title: Not a loose leaf tea: see the difference on the photos leaf vs no leaf

text: I researched California Poppy in regard to anxiety and trouble sleeping. I was prescribed a mild dose of Xanax to help because I have reoccurring stress dreams all night long that prevent me from getting good sleep. I wasn't comfortable with that so I started checking around and found this. I have been using it for only 1 week but I really notice a difference. I haven't taken the anti anxiety med or melatonin (another failed attempt) and I feel pretty good. I track my sleep with a Jawbone device and this has added at least 2 additional hours of solid sleep to my night. The dreams are lucid but not too crazy and it's a nice break from the usual 'I'm behind on this and it needs to be done now!' dreams. I don't wake up groggy and I can use it throughout the day for general anxiety and It doesn't  do anything but take the edge off. I don't even notice that part, I just realize at the end of the day the job seamed easier. I gave some to my husband to try and he had a crazy dream that left him rattled, so it's probably not for everyone but for me it works.

text: I have used this as sleep enhancing remedy for several months and find it quite effective. I tried Californai Poppy capsules and they do not do the job. I take one dropper full  of this extract in a cup of chamomile tea about an hour before sleep. Straight chamomile does nothing. The poppy  seems to help me wake up on time and be more alert, not over sleep, so it may be helping the quality of  sleep. I dislike the high alcohol level and the taste is truly vile, that is the reason for four stars. Herb Pharm has proved to be a reliable company of quality extracts but they don't make California Poppy in a glycerin, non alcohol form. I still recommend this and suggest putting it in an herb tea to avoid the taste.

text: I have a very high tolerance for benzodiazepines from years of being prescribed for insomnia, so I researched my problem and landed on studies of  Eschscholzia californica.  As others have stated in the reviews here - every person is unique, and no two people will experience the same effects.  With this in mind I read all the reviews and saw that people either had a good result or very little result and thought I'd try it for my severe chronic insomnia and see if it helped me.  After laying awake for 4 hours I took it (exactly as the label instructs) at 2:45am.  When I was still awake an hour later and got up to use the bathroom I was very startled to find I suddenly had severe double vision and a really unpleasant sensation in the front of my head.  After returning to bed I essentially blacked out for about 45 minutes and then snapped wide awake (where I stayed the rest of the night).  Fortunately for me the double vision passed in about 3 more hours.  I spent the next day with a headache and the realization that supplements like this are completely unregulated and I had NO IDEA what I had actually consumed when I took this product. The ingredients indicated on the label are "Alcohol 62%" and distilled water.  Perhaps it's wood alcohol? That might explain the bad visual disturbance and unpleasant headache.  I'm thankful my vision returned to normal the next day, as I could've experienced permanent damage from consuming a liquid made and sold by an unknown entity in an industry that has zero oversight.  Final word on this stuff: take at your own risk.  If the severe visual disturbance I experienced from it hadn't passed... I hate to imagine.  And 45 minutes of sleep for the night wasn't my goal. I threw the bottle in the trash the next day.  THINK TWICE ABOUT WHAT YOU MIGHT BE CONSUMING BEFORE TAKING THIS PRODUCT.
title: Main Ingredient Wood Alcohol??

text: I saw the many positive reviews on here and read some various literature online touting the wonderful relaxing effects of California poppy extract. I ordered a bottle and I have to say it was a complete waste of money. It had a strong, bitter alcohol taste (considering it is mixed with alcohol) that was difficult to mask, even when I boiled it in water to boil off some of the alcohol and added it to my tea. Since I use herbal extracts to relax, I am always on the lookout for new, helpful herbal remedies. For instance, I find passionflower and valerian extracts to be very effective. After reading about California poppy being a relaxant, pain reliever, etc. I had pretty high expectations. I have to say I was disappointed. Only after taking twice the suggested dosage did I feel a little relaxed, and even so, it was nowhere near as effective as valerian or passionflower. I did not have any interesting or lucid dreams, and it did nothing for pain. I suppose it works for some people, but it definitely didn't do a thing for me.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
name: California Poppy Tea Herb Organic 4 Ounce
description: This listing is for 1 - 4 ounce package of Organic California Poppy Herb. California Poppy Herb, or Eschscholzia californica, consists of the parts of the plant that grow above the ground, i.e., the leaves, stems and petals. These bulk herbs (which are really leaves and petals) are then dried and can be used as an infusion (as in tea) or an herbal tincture. A perennial native to the interior valleys of southern Oregon and California and ranging into the deserts of Nevada and Arizona, bulk California Poppy Herb has been used for several thousands of years by the Yokut and Pima Indians for its mildly sedative properties. Warning: Not to be used during pregnancy.
brand: California Poppy Tea Herb Organic 4 Ounce

text: I bought this set after buying Nighty Night from the grocery store and absolutely falling in love with it. I wanted to try the extra strength version that the store didn't carry and decided to get the variety pack here. I'll return with my thoughts on each flavor as I try them but wanted to go ahead and leave my feedback because I've loved my experience so far.🌙Nighty Night: A very full tea with a delicious and refreshing minty lilt. Drinking this tea is one of the few things I look forward to eveyday and while it doesn't have a sleepy affect it does work well to calm my nerves before bed.💤Nighty Night Extra: Very similar to Nighty Night but also contains valerian root. Valerian root has a very distinct and rather unpleasant smell but it's flavor isn't unpleasant, it reminds me of dandelion tea. Extra had a bit more body than regular Nighty Night and had the same affect on my sleepiness.🍃Lavender mint: This makes me feel like I'm drinking camomile tea. The distinctive floral taste of lavender coupled with refreshing mint is absolutely glorious. Perfect balance of flavors where the lavender is not too flowery, the mint not too electric… overall a very smoothing experience 😌🧘Camomile Lavender: Unlike the Lavender Mint the Lavender is a bit too overpowering for the camomile. For me, it's a bit too flowery and bitter in a way I can only balance with another less floral tea. Ideally I'd use another camomile but I didn't have any so I used the Nighty Night and while the Lavender is still very strong it's less biting.🫖Cinnamon: I'll be honest, I was NOT looking forward to trying this one. While I love a spicy ginger tea, cinnamon ain my thing 𝓱𝓸𝔀𝓮𝓿𝓮𝓻, I paired it with a generous splash of banana pudding whisky, strawberry gin, a spoonful of jujubes in honey tea and it was absolutely heavenly, buttery even. The cinnamon alone is actually rather pleasant, I was expecting it to be overpowering but it's not at all, more of a twange than in your face. It can actually lean fruity if you want it to, maybe throw in some lemon juice or peach tea. It could also go floral but I went the more cakey route and think this would be great to deepen the flavor profile of a butter beer or hot cocoa. Though it stands it's own it's definitely a more subdued tea than the others.🍋Lemon balm: Though lemon balm is part of the mint family it's definitely more citrusy in flavor than minty. It does however have a slightly minty aftertaste that's closest to spearmint in flavor and is easier to detect if you exhale through your nose between sips. This is the mildest of the tea flavors in this variety pack though it absolutely does have its own charm the slight lemony taste of this tea had me craving more. It tastes very much like lemon zest so while it's distinctly lemony tasting it's not super tangy. I decided to add a bag of lemon ginger tea with a couple splashes of lime to deepen and round out the perfectly cirtusy experience.To sum everything up my favorite was definitely the Lavender Mint with Nighty Night coming in at a very close second. If you're having issues with insomnia these teas unfortunately are not the answer but they are certainly useful in setting the stage for a restful night's sleep which is a fundamental part of good sleep hygiene. I personally have found cbn and indica gummies to be very useful and will mix them in my tea to amplify the calming affect of the tea and the sleepy affect of the gummies in this oddly perfect synergy that has my eyelids drooping before I can even finish the cup. I hope my review was helpful, happy steeping 😌
title: Sip up lads 🫖

text: It's still far too soon to say what benefits this might give me but one thing is sure, it most CERTAINLY gets you going! Now it's not an immediate thing so be patient and use caution and DON'T do what I did.I had me a nice cuppa wen it came and waited several hours (5? 6?) and nothing had happened yet. I thought, maybe I brewed it too weak. So I made a second cup before I laid down to sleep. I slept about 3 hours and woke up to intense pain and the need to GO!I raced to the bathroom and it was not like other over the counter laxatives that makes things watery and loose. Nooo, this was solid and urgent and painful and I felt heat wash over me and like I was going to throw up at the same time. Almost as if I had food poisoning kind of feeling. I remember closing my eyes once I had some relief (after I'd been sweating because of it and not from strain, no no... one does not strain and push too hard or else you have other problems to deal with). The next thing I know I am half-way waking up and not sure where I was or how I got there or what day it was.I had fainted somehow. Passed out cold and fallen off the toilet over beside it wedged between the toilet and the sink cabinet. Even after finally deducing where I was you would think I would try to get up. No. I couldn't. I was utterly without energy and strength and felt drugged. I don't think my eyes even completely opened. I fell back to 'sleep' there for who knows how long since I was at home alone. When I finally could wake and move I had to 'go' again and feared passing out, again. Luckily I didn't. Once business was handled on the toilet I got a shower and laid down for a few more hours and was woken with pains again.No passing out this time and it wasn't as painful but there was still discomfort. Stool was more loose and liquid this time but briefer. And so it's been off and on all night/morning for me.Moral of the story....Drink one or even only half a cup the first time and wait... WAIT! Even if you have to wait overnight, for the love of all that's holy wait. Otherwise you too might feel like you are dying and end up passed out in your bathroom floor. it does what it says it does. It cleans you out but be patient with that process or suffer the consequences.

text: I feel I have to leave a review here to give more of a balanced perspective on this product instead of the other reviews you're likely seeing from people that didn't do a whole lot of research before buying this product.TL:DR - Use this for relaxation and sleep. It's not an instant drowsiness but rather it feels as if you're naturally progressing towards sleep over 30-60min. DO NOT DRINK IT STRAIGHT. Take it with something sweet like orange juice. 15-20 drops outta do it. Also, the effects take longer to kick in if you take this and then continue to stare at a TV or computer screen.Detailed Background: My curiosity around California Poppy Seed Extract (CPSE) came from Tim Ferriss and his findings in The 4 Hour Body. There seemed to be some evidence that CPSE has some benefits around REM sleep. As someone who has trouble sleeping and wants to reduce the amount of sleep I need every day, this piqued my interest. So I went online, looked through a few academic papers, and pestered a few relatives that were pharmacists and doctors about this. Turns out, Tim's findings do hold some weight (although more rigorous studies and testing are definitely needed).I've been using this product for about 2-3 years now and I haven't had any issues. To be safe, I took Tim's advice and I stop taking this every three months for the duration of one month. And I've gone from using this every night to maybe 2-3 times a week and that's typically if I know I'm not going to get at least 6 hours of sleep. The boost to REM sleep definitely helps.I think one of the biggest takeaways is this isn't, at least in my case, an addictive substance and it doesn't have seem to have any significant side effects (unlike many major pharmaceutical products). If anything, it helped to train my body to get a regular sleep cycle and how to relax before bed. So that, even when I stop taking this for a month at a time, I still get a decent amount of sleep.So in short, the product works if you use it as intended. If you did zero research and you're going off the claims of Dr.Oz...frankly...you're kind of an idiot. Never trust one source, especially a celebrity. This doesn't magically cure pain. At least to my knowledge, I've never experienced it or come across any research that indicates that unless it's a placebo effect.Use this for sleep and relaxation, that's all. And if you want more info or struggle with either of those topics then I'd recommend taking a look through The 4 Hour Body. Several other tips there that have helped me out over the years.
title: Use As Intended - Sleep, Relaxation, and Tim Ferriss. (Note - This Is Not For Pain)

text: I'm still experimenting with dose but found even 7 or 8 drops directly to the tongue impart a gentle sedation for minor pain or sleep problems. The effect increases with larger dosage but I can see going through this wee bottle very quickly if you have moderate pain and need 20 or 30 drops. The effects fade after a couple hours. I wouldn't be comfortable using this at work or while driving as it makes me a little listless and sleepy.It tastes terrible--like fermented lawn clippings--but gets maximum effect dropped directly on my tongue. Even mixed in tea I can taste it but it blends in okay. I added it to a shot of Jack Daniels and the taste completely disappeared and made for a great nightcap on a restless night. Both poppy extract and a few bong loads of wild lettuce have proved to be effective for my occasional sleep or minor pain problems.

text: There are many products available which induce sleep in a variety of ways. The type of sleep also varies, as sleep comes at several different levels. Having grown California Poppies for decorative purposes, I was not aware of a medicinal application, and so I was somewhat dubious regarding effectiveness. This product did produce sleep when taken as directed. I used the product intermittently several times with similar results. The sleep was hypnotic in nature and without dreams. There was some residual grogginess the following day, but it was not intolerable. The product was not overly offensive to take with an interesting herb-like aroma and taste. So this California Poppy extract would be effective for occasional sleepless nights. I cannot offer an opinion about long term results.

text: These golden poppy seeds are absolutely SUPERB! I read online that poppy seeds required stratification for better and successful germination rate. So I stored in fridge for three weeks immediately after it was received. I loosen and prepared the soil prior before the rainstorm arrives in Southern California in early April, 2024. I carefully spray the seeds evenly by hand to covered the entire perimeter, then spray another very thin layer of good organic soil on top the seeds for good contact. The effort has paid off after just 13 days in ground. I read online that young juvenile poppy plants might not bloom on first year, but we will see!

text: I first heard of California Poppy for pain in 2012 when a segment on Dr. Oz discussed this item.  But it was hard to find ... and the stores only had it in liquid tincture form.  (Yuck!)  Forgot about the product for years, until I saw this during a LIGHTENING DEAL ... so I grabbed a bottle.  After consulting with my pain doc, I upped the dose.  2 at bedtime, 1 or 2 in the A.M., and 1 or 2 in the late afternoon.  They are NOT a miracle.  They have become an important part of my pain treatment plan.  Give them a good trial by using them on schedule,  for the whole first bottle.  Honestly, I panic if my supply is low.  As, far as dosage, start on a Friday night and see if they make you drowsy during the day on Saturday and Sunday ... Add a day dose during the next weekend.  I have no day drowsiness, yet they help me fall asleep faster, along with melatonin.  Most allopathic Doctors know nothing about California Poppyseed supplements.  They are NOT like a drugs related to poppy flowers (heroin).  They have not shown up during urine drug testing at work.

text: I love this brand and keep all the flavors in stock in my cupboard. I go to the Pure Mind blend on days when I have a lot of tasks to do. I can’t say that it helps me focus specifically any better than I would have, but just starting my day drinking this with good intention does 100% help me motivate and stay on task.Some people comment about the powder in the packets that shake loose from the bags. I find this is always the case when I order it by mail… it always comes to me in a paper or plastic mailer that takes a beating in transit. I have never had this problem when I buy it in stores though, so definitely a shipping issue. But I don’t mind the excess powder.Be careful when opening the packets, my boyfriend has a habit of ripping it lower than the tear line sometimes and you will rip the tea bag open this way .Taste 2.5/5Ingredients 5/5I find the flavor bland with a light taste of oregano. To combat the bland flavor , I usually steep my bags in conjunction with other more flavorful tea varieties.Overall, Highly recommend

text: I tried this for as-needed calming (rather than taking daily). First try: I was wired (brain rushing for no clear reason) and one capsule did help me relax in about 30 minutes, but it was right after a hot shower, which is also calming.Second time I tried this I was agitated and stressed. It helped, but not quickly. Two hours later I was depressed, but I doubt it had anything to do with the supplement. Likely just an off day for me.Third try, I took this around 5 pm for agitation. It helped a little bit, but slowly. However, I slept very well that night, better than expected.Poppy is believed to act on GABA receptors, which calm your central nervous system. Research is limited on California Poppy, but 250 mg (one of these capsules) might be a low dose. I’m not recommending you take more but, if results are lacking, dosage may be the reason. Similar products on Amazon are 600-800 mg per serving.Sleep is complex. California poppy will likely not help if your sleep issues are caused by liver or blood sugar problems. It may help if you’re too wound up to sleep.
title: Seems to help about half the time, if taken when needed. May be a dose issue?

text: This was the first California Poppy supplement I took.  I am coming close to attributing this as assuredly contributing but I  can't necessarily attribute just this as I've been taking several sleep aids off and on.  No side effects.  A couple of the other multi ingredient sleep aids also include less California Poppy and when using those I don't take this.  In general my goal has been more and better sleep and I'm finding that from a couple mixed ingredient sleep aids now so I'm not experimenting with this supplement much now that I've found the others.  Will probably experiment more with it later and update.Pros:I feel more calm and am getting better quality of sleep for what little I usually get.Value for 60days under $10.ConsNone noted.ABOUT ME AND SUPPLEMENTS:Supplements are sometimes easy to attribute a positive or negative though mostly they aren't attributable over months if ever.  I will try my best to review on what I see if I do and update if I find a change.  Supplements I'm generally not overjoyed with or that I have faith in the quality of as well as how economical they are to continue - I will not take past the bottle I'm using and thus won't update unless I revisit this not likely any time soon.I have been taking numerous supplements for decades and several more for many years.  Lately I have started some new supplements mixing in with existing.  I favor simple supplements with one or a few active ingredients that way I can decide how much of what I am taking.  In general supplements with tons of ingredients and especially ones that are aimed at one thing yet contain numerous supplements with little to no added benefits are worrisome.  I do not need (for example) to worry about getting 100 or 400 (whatever) each times the B vitamins needed in a day from five or ten or more different supplements.In experimenting I am usually taking for days or weeks some supplements then switching for a different brands equivalent noting differences if any.  Some I don't have an alternative and will use the entire amount without other brands in the mix.

text: At first, I thought this product was working well. California poppy activates the GABA receptors in the brain. GABA helps to calm the body and the mind, and counterbalances the neurotransmitter called “glutamate” which excites the body's central and peripheral nervous systems.However, too much GABA can cause the exact symptoms you are trying to prevent! This is what happened to me after 4 nights of taking 1ml of this product at night. I experienced anxiety (with a tight chest), restlessness, and slight shortness of breath. At first, I thought the symptoms I was trying to fix were just getting worse, so I increased my dose a little bit, but my symptoms got worse. This is when I realised the product was making me feel worse.Be mindful of your dosage and keep track your symptoms. If you don’t feel any better, maybe you are too sensitive and you’re increasing GABA too much like I experienced.I know the product caused this feeling because I’ve taken GABA powder in the past and felt the exact same thing when I no longer required it my body started reacting badly.
title: Can cause the exact symptoms you're trying to quell

text: It’s a Friday night, and I’m staring at a mountain of laundry that seems more like Everest after a long week. Normally, I’d tackle this chore with all the enthusiasm of a sloth on a hot day, but tonight, I had something different—a bottle of natural wild lettuce and California poppyseed extracts supplements. I’d heard these were supposed to be nature’s way of telling your body to chill out, so I decided to give them a whirl. I took a dose and braced myself for the inevitable laundry battle. As I started folding clothes, I noticed my usual end-of-week tension was melting away like butter on a hot skillet. The wild lettuce and poppyseeds were kicking in, and instead of dreading the task, I found myself humming along to a playlist I hadn’t paid attention to in ages. By the time I reached the bottom of the laundry basket, I was in full-on zen mode. The mundane had somehow transformed into a surprisingly enjoyable activity—who knew folding socks could feel this good? With my newfound sense of calm, I decided to take things up a notch. I dimmed the lights, brewed some herbal tea, and settled into my favorite chair with a book that had been collecting dust for way too long. Usually, my mind would wander after a few pages, but not tonight. The world around me seemed to slow down, and I got lost in the story, feeling more present and relaxed than I had in weeks. But the real magic happened when I finally hit the sack. I’m not exaggerating when I say I drifted off to sleep like a feather floating on a gentle breeze. No tossing, no turning, just a deep, restful sleep that left me feeling like I’d hit the reset button on my body and mind. The next day, I woke up refreshed and ready to take on the weekend. And the best part? I didn’t feel groggy or out of it—just calm, focused, and oddly energized. Even my usual Saturday errands felt less like a chore and more like a leisurely stroll through the day.

text: I take an herbal or homeopathic sleep aid every night, since I tend to need a little help to nudge me over the edge into dreamland. I'm happy to say that taking two of these capsules before bedtime has been VERY effective at helping me get to sleep.  I mean they work like a dang charm!  I could almost believe these had THAT kind of poppy in them (they do no actually have that kind of poppy. 🙂)  I'm happy to have these on hand, as they have proven so far to be a surefire knockout inducer.  I still need to resort to something more powerful if I've had caffeine or B vitamins too late in the day, but for everyday use these are a winner.

text: This Wild Lettuce and California Poppy Seed Extract offers a high-potency blend designed to support relaxation and aid in sleep. Each bottle contains 120 capsules, each packed with a potent combination of wild lettuce and California poppy seed extracts. This formula is tailored for those seeking natural relief from discomfort and enhanced relaxation.The capsules feature a strong dosage, with each serving providing 560 mg of wild lettuce extract and 40 mg of California poppy seed extract. The use of extract forms of these herbs allows for a higher concentration of their active ingredients, which can enhance their effectiveness compared to standard forms.Wild lettuce is well-regarded for its soothing properties and is commonly used to help alleviate discomfort and promote better sleep. Its calming effects make it a popular choice for those struggling with restlessness or minor discomfort that disrupts their sleep.California poppy, on the other hand, has a long history of use in traditional medicine for its ability to promote physical and mental relaxation. It can help in enhancing mood and providing relief from physical discomfort, making it a valuable addition to the formula for overall well-being.From my experience with these capsules, I found them to be somewhat effective in promoting relaxation and aiding in sleep. The high dosage of wild lettuce and California poppy seemed to work well in calming the mind and easing discomfort, which contributed to slightly better sleep quality. The vegetarian capsules were a bonus, ensuring that the supplement aligns with plant-based preferences.The capsules are manufactured in the USA in a GMP-certified facility, ensuring a high standard of quality and adherence to strict policies.Overall, Parker Naturals’ Wild Lettuce and California Poppy Seed Extract Capsules offer a potent, natural option for those seeking enhanced relaxation and sleep support. The high concentration of active ingredients and the vegetarian formulation make this a noteworthy choice for addressing discomfort and promoting restful sleep. It helped me a little, but not enough to purchase more. Others may see more pronounced benefits as everyone is different.Consulting a healthcare provider before starting any new supplement is advisable. Keep well (:

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2017
name: HawaiiPharm California Poppy and Valerian Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) Tincture Supplement 4 oz
description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather. Valerian Root also known as Valeriana officinalis. Common Valerian, European Valerian, Valeriana and Allheal. Valerian is a perennial plant, native to Europe and parts of Asia. It grows in meadows and woodlands within moist, temperate climates and has since been naturalized in North America. The root system consists of a vertical rhizome and an abundance of smaller rootlets which are harvested and dried at temperatures less than 105 degrees Fahrenheit.
features: Crude California Poppy and Valerian root extract of first cold extraction!
California Poppy and Valerian extract contains ONLY natural ingredients!
Super concentrated California Poppy and Valerian root extract: dry material / menstruum ratio 1:3!

We strictly use only organic or ethically sourced wild harvested material, highest quality alcohol, vegetable glycerin and crystal clear water! Really the BEST California Poppy and Valerian root extract on market!
brand: HawaiiPharm California Poppy and Valerian Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) and Valerian (Valeriana Officinalis) Tincture Supplement 4 oz

text: I go this tea because I was recently diagnosed with diverticulitis. I was kind of just looking for something to help relieve the symptoms in conjunction with the other preventative treatments. This tea contains peppermint, which is good to relieve an unhappy stomach. I can say that it does help a little to soothe the irritation and other stuff. But it isn't some kind of miracle elixer. One of the reasons I bought this was because lots of reviews said that it tasted great. That's just not true. I drink lots of teas. Being that my Wife is from China, I keep many different varieties at my house. This tastes far worse than any Ive had. It also leaves a very powerful aftertaste that doesnt go away easily. No big deal, we arent drinking this for pleasure. I just wanted to set the record straight on the flavor issue. The price is also very outrageous. Another reason I thought it either did a great job and might taste really good. It seems to be priced high for no reason at all. I think that after I finish this stuff off, I won't be buying more. It works just ok, taste bad and cost too much.
title: Helps a little to soothe symptoms but tastes awful.

text: I decided to give Nelson's Tea Really Root Beer a try, intrigued by the idea of a tea that promised the classic taste of root beer in a loose leaf format. At first sip, the blend of sarsaparilla root and other flavors did remind me of the nostalgic beverage, offering a unique twist on my usual tea routine.The flavor profile is interesting, marrying the earthy notes of herbal tea with the distinct, slightly sweet essence of root beer. It's a novel concept that captures the essence of the soda without the fizz, making it a cozy, caffeine-free alternative for evenings.However, the price tag gave me pause. It's on the higher end for tea, which might make one reconsider its value, especially if you're an avid tea drinker looking for a daily staple. While the novelty and taste are commendable, the cost factor could be a deterrent for those on a budget or for whom tea is a frequent indulgence.In conclusion, Nelson's Tea Really Root Beer is a fun, flavorful experiment for those looking to spice up their tea collection. If the unique flavor combination calls to you and the price isn't a concern, it's worth a try. Otherwise, you might find better value in exploring other teas that offer both satisfaction and a more reasonable price point.

text: I’ve been using this to flavor the second fermentation (F2) of kombucha and water kefir.  I made the tea twice as strong as Nelson’s directions stated, strained and added a bit of sugar (@20g sugar per cup of tea).  Once cooled, I add two tablespoons of the sweetened rootbeer tea per 16 oz. of F1 kombucha (or water kefir) and bottle with a tight lid.

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

I found a video on Tik Tok of a girl talking about ways to help period cramps and she mentioned raspberry tea. Honestly, I was skeptical. How is a tea going to help my cramps....A little back story, I decided to take a break from birth control. Doing so brought back my really really really bad cramps. We are talking about gagging, nausea, cramping, bloating, etc. I drink this tea the first few days of my cycle and really alleviated the pain. My most recent period was surprisingly easy to get through - almost no cramping. The taste is not my favorite, but I will easily look past it because of how much it helps me. Will continue to repurchase.

features: SLEEP TEA - Sourced from the premium tea estates of India. Valerian root and Chamomile comes together in this soothing blend to gently lull you into a state of relaxation. Enjoy as a sleep aid at bedtime to support tranquility and relaxation.

TASTING NOTES - Earthy | Relaxing with Sweet, Floral notes - The valerian root also known as ‘sugandhbala’ in India grows on the rolling hills and deep valleys of Kalimpong in the temperate Himalayas. It is this tranquil terroir that produces ingredients that are blended together in this blend. The result is a cup of calm, light, earthy, and gently floral cup of tea that will steep you into relaxation.
USDA CERTIFIED ORGANIC - Luxmi Estates uses only the Highest Grade Organic ingredients grown in our own Estates for healthy flavorful brew. Our Herbal Teas are Kosher Free, Caffeine Free.
NATURAL INGREDIENTS, ALWAYS - All our blends are organic and made of natural ingredients with no additives. This tea includes Valerian Root, Chamomile, Licorice, Rose petals, Peppermint, Lavender.
TRY OUR OTHER FLAVORS: There's a tea for any time in the day. Try our English Breakfast, Masala Chai, Ashwagandha Tea, Earl Grey, Turmeric Tea, Organic teas and a variety of our herbal teas.
THE HAND OF ABUNDANCE - 1% of sales from this tea pack goes into supporting women and their communities across the 23 estates through access to education, healthcare and water.

A CENTURY OF TEA MAKING - From the Himalayas and the flood plains of Assam to the Nyungwe forest, our 23 estates are amongst the finest tea growing regions in the world. A true confluence of nature’s bounty, the rich biodiversity and unique ecosystems they form, Our teas are some of the world’s most unique brews.

ECO-CONSCIOUS TEA BAGS: Our premium tea bags are constructed of Non PLA bio mesh. They are free of dyes, adhesive, and chlorine bleach. No staples and extra waste, food grade environmentally friendly and non toxic - just delicious tea!

features: SLEEP TEA - Sourced from the premium tea estates of India. Valerian root and Chamomile comes together in this soothing blend to gently lull you into a state of relaxation. Enjoy as a sleep aid at bedtime to support tranquility and relaxation.

TASTING NOTES - Earthy | Relaxing with Sweet, Floral notes - The valerian root also known as ‘sugandhbala’ in India grows on the rolling hills and deep valleys of Kalimpong in the temperate Himalayas. It is this tranquil terroir that produces ingredients that are blended together in this blend. The result is a cup of calm, light, earthy, and gently floral cup of tea that will steep you into relaxation.
USDA CERTIFIED ORGANIC - Luxmi Estates uses only the Highest Grade Organic ingredients grown in our own Estates for healthy flavorful brew. Our Herbal Teas are Kosher Free, Caffeine Free.
NATURAL INGREDIENTS, ALWAYS - All our blends are organic and made of natural ingredients with no additives. This tea includes Valerian Root, Chamomile, Licorice, Rose petals, Peppermint, Lavender.
TRY OUR OTHER FLAVORS: There's a tea for any time in the day. Try our English Breakfast, Masala Chai, Ashwagandha Tea, Earl Grey, Turmeric Tea, Organic teas and a variety of our herbal teas.
THE HAND OF ABUNDANCE - 1% of sales from this tea pack goes into supporting women and their communities across the 23 estates through access to education, healthcare and water.

A CENTURY OF TEA MAKING - From the Himalayas and the flood plains of Assam to the Nyungwe forest, our 23 estates are amongst the finest tea growing regions in the world. A true confluence of nature’s bounty, the rich biodiversity and unique ecosystems they form, Our teas are some of the world’s most unique brews.

ECO-CONSCIOUS TEA BAGS: Our premium tea bags are constructed of Non PLA bio mesh. They are free of dyes, adhesive, and chlorine bleach. No staples and extra waste, food grade environmentally friendly and non toxic - just delicious tea!
brand: Luxmi Estates - Valerian Dream - Organic Valerian Root Tea for Sleep - 25 Tea Bags | with Valerian Root, Chamomile & Lavender | Perfect Wellness Sleep Tea

description: California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) is a typical species of herbaceous plants of the genus Eschscholzia. The stem is straight or branched, smooth, sometimes bluish in color. The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.

The root is rod, powerful. A flower is solitary with yellow to orange petals. California Poppy blooms from February to September. The flower closes at night and in cold windy weather, and opens again in the morning, but may remain closed if it is cloudy weather.
features: California Poppy Alcohol-FREE liquid extract contains ONLY natural ingredients!

We strictly use Only Certified or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST California Poppy herbal glycerite on market!

text: I started drinking hibiscus tea after a friend recommended the Micro Ingredients Organic Hibiscus Flowers, and I’m so glad I did! Not only does it have a refreshing, slightly tart flavor that I love, but I’ve also noticed significant improvements in my overall health and well-being since I began incorporating it into my daily routine.After just a few weeks of drinking this tea, I’ve felt more energized, and my digestion has improved. But what’s truly remarkable is the impact it’s had on my skin—I've noticed a visible increase in skin elasticity and a healthy glow that I hadn’t seen before.The quality of these hibiscus flowers is excellent. They’re cut and sifted perfectly for brewing, and you get a generous amount in the 2-pound bag, which lasts a long time. It’s also great knowing that the product is organic, caffeine-free, and free from any additives or sugars.Overall, I highly recommend the Micro Ingredients Organic Hibiscus Flowers to anyone looking for a natural way to boost their health and enjoy a delicious cup of tea. It’s become a staple in my daily routine, and the benefits are undeniable!
title: Fantastic health benefits & delicious flavor!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024
name: Micro Ingredients Organic Hibiscus Tea Bags, 200 Count | Premium Source for Herbal Tea | Eco-Friendly Hemp Paper Tea Bags | Caffeine Free, Non-GMO, No Sugar
features: Micro Ingredients offers USDA organic certified hibiscus tea, contained in Abacá hemp fiber paper bags, makes traditional herbal iced or hot brewed tea, free of dyes, adhesives, glues, and bleach.
Each pouch contains a 14oz supply of fresh hibiscus tea bags, provides 2,000mg organic hibiscus flowers from hibiscus sabdariffa per serving, 200 total tea bags.
Simply drop a bag into your favorite cup, add 8oz of hot boiling water, steep tea bag for 5-7 minutes, enjoy a vibrant and flavorful infusion that tastes refreshingly sweet, tart, and tangy.

Hibiscus tea has been used for centuries due to its cherished flavor profile and versatile health benefits. It is naturally loaded with antioxidants for supporting heart health and digestive concerns.

text: I have been drinking this for four days now and Im pretty upset that I still haven’t seen or felt any changes. The tea tastes amazing though that’s the only reason I gave it above a one. But that could be the amount of honey I like with my tea. That being said I feel taken advantage of for a small box of tea bags costing over thirty dollars when I feel like I could get the same thing from a store for about $2.50-$4. I had been a smoker for 14 years and when I got this I had high hopes on clearing out my lungs of all those toxins. Granted I’m only on day four and tbh I will have two cups or more a day. (I really this enjoy tea) but that being said I should feel like my lungs are expanding, I should be coughing up mucus, or I should at least notice SOMETHING! Now I’m going to finish the whole box using one tea bag a day (reusing the tea bag for extra cups) and hope something happens but for now I’m disappointed. DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT AND WASTE TOUR MONEY!!! It’s a placebo effect!

text: I have been drinking Buddha Teas for many years now and have tried quite a few of their different blends. Most importantly, they have all been wonderful!!! text: Took a few weeks to receive. Kind of makes you wonder where it is coming from.The ingredients list looks good.  The name of the tea makes it seem great, but also says that it is a detox tea.  May give some folks the wrong impression.A small amount of tea is used when made according to the directions, so not sure of the potency.  The directions are to simmer the tea, rather than to steep it—which is a little unusual.The flavor of the tea is not overwhelming and it is easy to drink.Too early to tell if there are any immediate, short, or long term benefits and/or effects.

text: I drink a cup of this tea literally every night before bed. It is so warming, slightly sweet, and just really satisfying. I don't know about the calming effects of it, but it has become part of my nighttime ritual and it definitely helps me to relax. It also doesn't need anything added to it and can steep for a while without ever getting bitter.
title: Obsessed with this tea
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2024
name: Yogi Tea Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea - 16 Tea Bags per Pack (6 Packs) - Calming Sleep Tea - Supports Good Sleep - Includes Chamomile Flower, Rooibos Leaf, Roasted Chicory Root & More
description:
Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea is a carefully crafted sleep tea, designed to help you unwind after a long day. It's a unique blend of Chamomile Flower, Skullcap, and L-Theanine, all known for their soothing properties that aid relaxation and support good sleep.
This tea is made with natural ingredients. These ingredients, coupled with the added flavors of Vanilla and Caramel, create a tea that is not only beneficial for sleep but also offers a delicious and warming flavor.
Additionally, our tea bags are filled with Rainforest Alliance Certified Rooibos, which means that every sip of this delicious tea supports wildlife conservation efforts.
For over five decades, we’ve been making delicious, functional teas inspired by the ancient holistic healing philosophy of Ayurveda. Our diverse tea selection supports everyday well-being with specialized herbal formulas thoughtfully blended for both health benefits and appealing flavor.
 Yogi is a Certified B Corporation producing more than 40 tea blends from over 100 organic spices and botanicals sourced from around the globe. With every ingredient we source, and every tea bag we make, we strive to support environmental sustainability and social responsibility. We do so by following highly selective sourcing standards, performing rigorous quality tests, mandating environmentally sound farming practices, and partnering with local communities. Through such partnerships, we want to empower our entire tea ecosystem to live healthy, vibrant lives. It is our hope that our commitment to goodness shines through in every cup of Yogi tea.
features: Organic Sleep Tea: Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea is purposefully blended with Chamomile Flower, Skullcap, and L-Theanine to support relaxation and good sleep
Delicious Calming Tea: Naturally sweet Rooibos combines with notes of Vanilla and Caramel for a delicious and warming tea; unwind from the day with a comforting cup
Tea Bag Instructions: Bring water to boiling and steep the tea bag for 7 minutes; for a stronger tea, use 2 tea bags; drink before bedtime
Premium Tea Ingredients: This Yogi tea is vegan and NON-GMO, so you can be sure you're getting the best in every cup
Uniquely Yogi: We believe in using the highest quality spices and botanicals, complementing them with intriguing, delightful flavors, qualities that make all of our teas uniquely Yogi
brand: Yogi Tea Soothing Caramel Bedtime Tea - 16 Tea Bags per Pack (6 Packs) - Calming Sleep Tea - Supports Good Sleep - Includes Chamomile Flower, Rooibos Leaf, Roasted Chicory Root & More

text: I have found that alternating my bedtime teas helps. This is my latest of 4 that I use, and it immediately became my favorite. The scent is rich and reminds me of Tiramisu. As it's cooling, I sit and breathe it in. The taste is the same and sweet enough, but sometimes I add a teaspoon of local honey.It helps me fall asleep easier. I also alternate several different forms of Melatonin (patch, liposomal, compound and sublingual) and some other natural supplements along with the teas. All in all, they're not perfect, but they make my nights restful, even if I don't sleep like a log straight through. I've done all the recommended things for getting restful sleep, including dark room, sleeping away from electrical outlets, early supper, and I don't drink coffee, tea or use refined sugars or gluten. So yes, I'm trying, and this tea makes it all a little easier. I'm at a stage in my life where I have to accept that my nights of falling into bed, going out like a light and sleeping 8 or 9 hours are past. I've read a few books on insomnia, and it helps to know that our ideal sleep schedule is a modern invention. People used to go to bed when the sun went down, sleep for 3 or 4 hours, get up and putter around, maybe even visit neighbors, then go back to bed and sleep till sunrise. It helps is you don't think of periodic wakefulness as a handicap. On the nights when I simply can't lie in bed, I get up, accompanied by my shih tzu, and pile up on the sofa with my iPad or watch TV for a couple of hours, then go back to bed when I'm sleepy.Thank you, Yogi, for your healthy, soothing teas. I use a lot of them.

text: So this is a great energizing tea. I have it every morning, and I'm definitely more alert and productive with it. No crash later on in the day. However, if I don't have it, I do get a massive headache. It says 'no headache', but I get the headache w/out it (just no crash the same day). Probably addicted to caffeine, but I didn’t have this problem before with just straight black tea.  And it's really expensive for tea, but I'm so energized and productive with it - I really like it. It's pepperminty-flavor. I had been doing straight black tea for years, but this is definitely better. I try some days to go back to black tea, and it's nice, but doesn't quite have the pick-me-up that this does. I add a little honey to it for sweetness. Yum! The price is a real drawback, but it's quality tea. If you purchase directly on website instead, you can subscribe and purchase more at a time (e.g. 60 bags every 2 months) and it's cheaper. I definitely use my subscription! Still love it. Update: Oh no! They're out of stock! I have tried in vain to find a good replacement (end up mixing mint and black tea...not the same...at all). Soooo sad! This is really the best tea out there. I love it. My favorite morning ritual. Will need to stockpile some when they are back in stock so I never have to run out again! :-)

text: First off, this product does EXACTLY what it's meant to do - help you fall asleep! I'm not a huge tea fan personally, but after a myriad of pills, supplements, and what felt like everything under the sun to try to fall asleep and stay asleep, I stumbled upon CogniTea. Finally, I was able to get a good nights rest after months!Initially, the scent of the bag itself is nice. It has a good, comforting aroma. However once you let the tea diffuse for around 8 minutes, it's different. The once comforting aroma is pungent and makes you wrinkle your nose. The taste itself is so bad, sour and unappetizing that you'll only be able to take a sip or two at a time, lest you risk an upset stomach. However, please note that I never put anything else in my tea. No sugar, honey, or creamer to help with the taste or smell.Overall, the tea itself helps you fall asleep but it's a doozy to drink, and is nothing short of an unenjoyable nightly battle.

text: We all know that getting a good night sleep can be a challenging endeavor.  My wife and I wanted to try a few tea options to see how they impacted our ability to fall asleep, stay asleep, and feel refreshed the next morning.  CogniTea’s DeepSleep product was one of the products we decided to try and I’m glad we did!I am a fairly heavy sleeper, but consider myself a night owl at times.  I want to go to bed early, but it just doesn’t happen.  I find that once I try to get back on track with an earlier bedtime, I lay there for what seems to be hours trying to fall asleep.  Recognizing these situations beforehand and having CogniTea’s Deep Sleep product has helped me relax, settle my mind, and ultimately get to sleep sooner.  I’m not an every day tea drinker but this product helps me when I need it most.  I especially like that I can leave the product in the mug and not come back to a bitter drink, regardless of how long I let it steep.My wife on the other hand is an extremely light sleeper.  If I so much as move during the night,  I’m waking her up unfortunately.  I convinced her to try Deep Sleep a week ago and she has been sleeping like a log since.  She’s now drinking it every day, has told me she isn’t waking up to use the restroom in the middle of the night, and says her sleep data is drastically improved.  While I may be a casual user of this product, I think my wife is hooked.I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking to improve their sleep!

text: I purchased this tea for myself. I have had a hard time getting tired ,falling asleep, and staying asleep. The tea does indeed calm you down enough so that you are able to get groggy but not necessarily fall asleep. I like to drink this tea as well as take my  Alteril before going to sleep . I will usually drink the tea an hour before I take my meds , then I will attempt to go to sleep . You don’t get a lot of tea bags to be honest but if you use them wisely they are worth the price and the tea doesn’t taste bad either . If you have any stomach acid problems like me make sure to drink a lot of water with this tea because it has a tendency to mess with the stomach well maybe it’s just me . text: Id sleep for a couple hours, then be up for hours in the middle of the night, sometimes even with melatonin in my system.My sister initially bought this tea for me from Whole Foods to help with that broken sleep.It works, and it works great!!!!!I went through the first box of tea and found this deal on Amazon.I had a friend try it bc he has broken sleep, too...  Not anymore!!!  It worked for him, too.  Gifted him a box bc of this deal... In the spirit of pay it forward, and bc I want my friend to get solid rest.  It is so important for us all.Anyway, I used to take melatonin.  Even with that, I'd wake up and stay up at times, then be groggy in the morning (only if I didn't get a full night of sleep).Anyway, I enjoy and appreciate drinking the tea instead of taking a pill.  It's a new evening ritual.Very important to let the tea steep for the 15 minutes as started in the directions.  Mild taste.Buy the tea and enjoy your rest. 😁🍵

text: These were a gift for a very dear friend who has cancer.  I had previously given her a goodie box & included 1 box of the Nighty Night Tea.  A few weeks ago she told how much she liked it & she had used up that box.  I know that she has difficulty sleeping at times, so I looked at what you had available & I liked this bundle.  I ordered it for her & had it delivered to her.  She was so thrilled.  She told me how relaxing this tea is & how much she enjoys it.  I felt really good knowing I had given her something she really enjoys & that helps her get a good nights sleep.  I highly recommend this tea.  This is one of my favorite teas that I’ve enjoyed for about 5 years.  Traditional Medicinals makes fabulous teas, they’re so smooth, so flavorful & helps me relax.  I highly recommend this flavor because of it’s relaxing & calming effect at bedtime.

text: This tea is great!  I have been under a lot of stress lately, and this tea has definitely helped me get to sleep.  I have been drinking it for about a month now as needed.  I feel like I sleep a bit more deeply when I drink this, which I have attributed to being more relaxed at bedtime.  It is not a miracle, but I think that the tea itself along with the routine of having it before bed really helps me to relax.Make sure you steep it as directed for 10-15minutes.  I have noticed that if I do not cover my cup to keep the heat in the tea does not come out as strong.  I didn't give it 5 stars only because the flavor is not my favorite.  Its nice for sure, but a bit mild for me.  It is a better and more complex flavor than any other nighttime relaxation tea I have tried.  I prefer to either make a strong cup or sometimes I steep it with a bag of chamomile tea as well which makes a very nice flavor.  I typically have one cup an hour before bed and another while I sit in bed and read right before I go to sleep.  After the first cup I feel more calm, after the second cup I feel drowsy and ready for sleep! I bought the case of six because I have enjoyed this product so much!

features: Pure & Reliable Leaf Tea Choice : Crafting marvelous tea bags from finest ingredients. Our papaya Leaves are grown using sustainable methods, freshly picked, naturally dried leaves, and ground into papaya tea bags. Each tea bag undergoes strict quality control to ensure a premium-quality papaya tea experience for you.

Papaya leaf tea, renowned for its rich nutritional profile, may contribute to overall well-being, making this leaf tea a perfect addition to your daily routine. Papaya tea may be helpful for a healthy life style and other benefits

Delightful Papaya Leaf Tea : Discover the traditional benefits of papaya leaf tea, also known as te de papaya. Renowned for its potential health benefits. This organic papaya tea has been cherished in various cultures for its soothing properties and delightful Tea flavor.

PREMIUM PAPAYA LEAF TEA BAGS; Akshit follows the International Standards Organic in our papaya processing. Ensuring that we provide quality products for the well-being. From our farms to your tea cups.

PAPAYA LEAF TEA BAGS; Organic papaya tea bags are processed in a clean environment, for healthy lifestyle. Papaya tea has no preservatives, no additives, no artificial colors or flavor. The papaya tea bags have no strings, staples, no dyes

CAFFEINE-FREE TEA: Our papaya leaf tea bags offer a caffeine-free alternative to coffee and other teas, allowing you to feel fresh, smooth, and rejuvenated every day. Enjoy the benefits of papaya leaf tea year-round, without the effects of caffeine, for a refreshing and youthful experience with every sip. Experience a celebration of flavors with premium papaya leaf loose tea—a party in a cup! Whether it's a tranquil morning, a serene afternoon, or a relaxing evening, savor the sweetness of papaya leaf in every sip. Perfect anytime, elevate your moments with each enchanting cup.

BENEFITS: Our Papaya Leaf Tea Bags offer a myriad of benefits beyond just a delightful beverage. Papaya tea is know for its numerous benefits. Enjoy the smooth, calming nature of papaya tea which may provide relaxation after a long day.

We ensure that you receive only the best of nature in every cup. We believe in harnessing the power of organic papaya leaves to enhance your health naturally. Steep the papaya tea bag in hot water, wait for it 3-5 mins, add a sweetener of your choice. Can serve the leaves tea hot or iced.

Our papaya leaf tea is versatile, perfect for enjoying either hot tea or cold. Whether you prefer it as a soothing leaf tea or evening beverage to unwind after a long day or a revitalizing morning pick-me-up to kickstart your day, it fits seamlessly into any lifestyle and occasion.

Embrace the caffeine-free enjoyment of our papaya leaf tea, a delightful beverage that complements your lifestyle and enhances your daily routine in multiple ways. The natural sweetness and exotic flavor of papaya tea provide a refreshing break from the ordinary, making it an enjoyable treat at any time.

title: My favorite nighttime ritual
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2024
name: The Republic of Tea, Get Some Zzz’s – No. 5 Herb Tea for Rest, No Caffeine, 36 Tea Bags
features: HERB TEA FOR REST: Say goodnight to tossing and turning. Steep a pot of our caffeine-free herbal blend and breathe a sigh of sweet relief as the bouquet of organic rooibos, soothing chamomile, passionflower and the mellowing properties of valerian gently lulls you toward blissful effects*. Valerian won't interfere with REM sleep, so you won't have to contend with the morning hangover that often results from sleep-aids.

ORGANIC RED ROOIBOS: The Wonder Herb of South Africa Full-bodied and aromatic, caffeine-free red rooibos is celebrated for its flavor and antioxidants. As the base for this tea, it's a natural friend to the immune system and can contribute to a healthier life.* All of our Be Well Teas are meticulously formulated for specific needs. text: I enjoy this Hibiscus tea so much! I add a teaspoon of honey. It's flavor reminds me of a cross between fruit punch and lemonade. Delicious hot or cold. Love the pretty can these teabags come in. Keeps them fresh and flavorful. This brand's tea (no matter which selection) is very authentic tasting. One thing I didn't expect was the added bonus of Hibiscus lowering my blood pressure! My last checkup had my Doc asking me what I was doing differently. I drink 3 cups a day and enjoy every drop. I can recommend this brand and will be happy to purchase again.

text: I really enjoy a cup of tea in the evenings and have tried a number of different bedtime and calming tea. I have a couple favorites and tend to rotate through those and try others. I was excited to add this one into the mix. It's not bad... I'd say the flavor is less pronounced than some of my others, but it's okay. I usually use tea bags, so it's fun to try a loose leaf and compare. I did notice that some of the smaller pieces came out on the two different style tea holders I used. I'm not sure if this normal with loose leaf, but I don't care for sipping on those. As for a calming effect, it is probably comparable to the others I drink. It's a nice tea. I do think the price is a little steep (no pun intended) if you haven't already tried the tea to know you like it. It is a big bag though, so it'll last a while.

text: The verdict is in! It's a yes for me! It takes about 30 minutes for me to feel the effects but once I do, wow! I sleep so soundly and even though tea usually makes me use the restroom in the same way as water, I get such sound sleep for like 4 - 5 hours after the effects hit. It makes me feel so fancy making it with all the ingredients, too haha. Would recommend on those nights you can't seem to sleep!

text: As someone who struggles with winding down after a long day, I'm always on the lookout for natural remedies to promote relaxation and better sleep. First and foremost, the aroma of this tea is absolutely divine. The blend of lavender, chamomile, and linden blossom creates a soothing scent that instantly calms my senses and prepares me for a peaceful night's sleep. With each sip, I can feel the tension melting away, allowing me to fully unwind and relax. But it's not just about the aroma – the ingredients in this tea are carefully selected to promote restful sleep. Valerian and passion flower work together to ease tension and quiet the mind, helping me drift off into a deep and rejuvenating slumber.

text: Not normally a fan of loose-leaf tea, I always have a hard time making it. But, with my wife and I having issues getting a good night's rest, I figured we could try this. So far so good. the taste isn't bad, it is very flowery though, so if you're not into that it likely won't be the tea for you. We've had some restful sleep after taking it, and we look forward to using it in the near future as needed.

text: I don't think there is anything about this tea that is specifically tuned to relaxation, etc. except that it doesn't have caffein and has a nice floral bouquet. It only is calm and relaxing, IMHO, if it becomes part of a routine/ritual where you can otherwise take some time and enjoy the taste and aroma experience in the right mindset. In that case, it's more about the other things than the tea, but this certainly fits the bill. There may be less expensive options, but this is a good one.

text: This is a nighttime tea with chamomile, lavender, linden blossom, valerian root, lemon balm, passion flower, and rose petals in it. As you can imagine, it has a floral scent/taste, which is very relaxing and soothing but might not be to everyone's taste. It is caffeine-free. It suggests on the back to use it with a filter bag, but I used it in a regular tea strainer with no issues. The leaves are large enough that I didn't get sediment in my tea.It is quite expensive but a large bag, considering you only need one heaped teaspoon for 8oz of water. There are an estimated 33 cups in the bag, so it is slightly less than a dollar a cup, but that's still more expensive than some other teas I've tried that come in at less than fifty cents per cup.The scent is quite strong and looks quite pretty, so if you don't want to drink this as tea, you could use it for potpourri. I liked it as tea but I think the lavender could be toned back slightly.

text: I've been struggling with sleep issues for more than a year, often getting only 3-5 hours of sleep and taking hours to fall asleep. My nighttime routine has been inconsistent. My doctor prescribed several medications and I've tried many over-the-counter options like melatonin, zzzquil. I decided to establish a better sleep routine. Now, I shower, follow my skincare routine, have a cup of tea, and head to bed. I also use mood lighting and play relaxing music. After finishing the tea and lying down I fell asleep within 15 minutes. It also has a very pleasant taste. I’m happy with this product and going to order more.

text: This is a new brand for me, and I couldn't be happier. The price is better than my usual brands, and you can buy small packets to try the flavor. I buy loose leaf tea, and always make ice tea, using the cold brew method. (put filter and water in pitcher, leave on counter for a couple hours, then refrigerate for 8-12 hours, or when it seems done) As you can see in the pictures, I have 2 pitchers going at once. The other pitcher has another tea from this manufacturer.This tea has a strong ginger taste, which probably is why it comes first in the name, lol! I'm used to ones that are peach first, then ginger, which isn't as strong. It's okay with me, but I'm glad I didn't add some fresh ginger pieces to it when it was brewing! I like to add frozen fruit to my tea when drinking it, to keep it cold, and add a little flavor.The first picture is of the dry tea before it is brewed, straight out of the packet. You can see big chunks of fruit in there, with other spices and tea. The aroma is magical.The second picture is the tea after it's been brewed. You can see the chunks have all expanded, letting out all of their goodness.  I haven't seen many other brands that have similar qualities. The third picture is of my two pitchers, both filled with Tiesta Tea, one being the Ginger Sweet Peach, the one on the right.Yes, I highly recommend this product.
title: Lovely loose leaf tea, strong ginger flavor

text: Costco used to sell this tea as an immunity tea.  My mom is obsessed with it and drinks it religiously anytime she feels under the weather or in general during flu season.  Given the ingredients list, it is probably a good source of vitamin C and antioxidants.  It is a loose leaf tea that definitely benefits from having a fine-mesh tea strainer.  It is also really strong and quite tart, but then again so is rose hip tea.  I like that it is non-caffeinated and in bulk, so you can decide how much you want to brew.  Each bag lasts a long time so we only reorder it a couple times a year.

name: Tiesta Tea - Lavender Chamomile, Soft Chamomile Herbal Tea, Premium Loose Leaf Tea Blend, Non Caffeinated, 200 Cups - 8 Ounce Resealable Bulk Pouch
features: SOFT CHAMOMILE HERBAL TEA: Embrace the serene and comforting essence of our Lavender Chamomile tea. This loose leaf blend artfully combines the soothing aroma of lavender with the gentle warmth of chamomile, delivering a tranquil and soothing retreat in every cup. It's your invitation to unwind and discover your own peaceful moment, sip by sip.

PREMIUM LOOSE LEAF TEA BLEND: Elevate your tea ritual with our meticulously crafted premium loose leaf blend. We've carefully sourced the finest natural ingredients, including premium chamomile, lemongrass, and lavender, to awaken your senses. As you bid farewell to disposable tea bags, you'll embrace the opulent richness that's visible in the vibrant tea leaves, aromatic in its scent, and truly savored in each cup.

RESEALABLE BULK POUCH FOR TEA LOVERS: Our charming and reusable pouch is the perfect gift for tea enthusiasts. Offering airtight storage, it ensures that your chamomile loose leaf tea remains cozy and fresh for 140-200 cups. Not only a functional addition to your tea collection, but it also sits beautifully on your countertop, a testament to your passion for fine teas.

EFFORTLESS BREWING: Enjoy a hassle-free brewing experience with our chamomile loose leaf tea. Simply scoop 1.5 tsp of this delightful loose leaf tea blend for every 8 oz of hot water at 208 degrees Fahrenheit. Allow it to steep for 5-7 minutes to release the full spectrum of flavors. Then, savor the moment as you remove the tea leaves and indulge in your perfectly steeped cup. It's the ideal way to appreciate the rich and aromatic notes of our premium blend.

I don't care for mint at all.If you like good tea with lots of flavor, do yourself a solid and get this.

name: Olvvla - Natural Calendula Flowers Tea Bags - 1.5g X 50 Count - Premium Calendula Tea - Non-GMO - Caffeine-free - Dried Calendula Herbal Tea - Rich in Antioxidants & Promote Relaxation
features: CALENDULA HERBS: We only selected vibrant and orange-red calendula flowers as raw material, which is 100% pure natural without any artificial additives. They are dried as whole buds, then cut and sifted to ensure greater aroma and the release of nutrition;

DELICATE & MELLOW: A cup of natural calendula tea brings you a feeling of elegance and gentleness. Although it may taste slightly bitter, it's more of a delicate and mellow flavor. Of course, you can also add honey or sugar as you like to get a better flavor;

text: These tea pouches have such a nice flavor and make a delicious iced tea. It is lemony with notes of lavender, but the lavender is not overpowering. It is sweetened (just a note if you need to worry about sugar grams) but not disgustingly so, just enough to bring out the flavors. Sometimes I get sidetracked while I’m waiting for my tea to steep, but this one does not get bitter like many teas do if you leave the bags in too long. It’s also not caffeinated, so it’s great to enjoy in the evening.

text: Have been drinking pure kava root for years, decided to get into experimenting with tinctures; this is the strongest and most pure I’ve found yet, between online and local dealers— so much so that I rarely buy from anyone else anymore. Though, my one concern is quality of consistency. I will purchase a few more times before I come to a conclusion and comment definitely on consistency though. I say this because it would be nice to just invest in the 64oz, so long as shelf life doesn’t play a roll in keeping kava long term.
title: Best kava tincture yet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
name: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
description: The California poppy is the state flower of California, a tender perennial plant bearing blue-green leaves and 2 to 4 inch (5 to 10 cm) wide flowers that open in bright sun and close on cloudy days and at night. The California poppy is considered an ancient plant whose origins are not entirely known. Native Americans in California prized them as a source of food and for the oil that could be extracted from the plant. Eschscholzia californica was the first named member of the genus Eschscholzia, which was named by the German botanist Adelbert von Chamisso after the Baltic German botanist Johann Friedrich von Eschscholtz, his friend and colleague on Otto von Kotzebue’s scientific expedition to California and the greater Pacific in mid-1810s aboard the Russian ship Rurik.
features: California Poppy Glycerite contains ONLY natural ingredients! Alcohol Free! Gluten Free! Non-GMO!

High Quality California Poppy NON-Alcohol liquid extract - we use classic conventional methods of extraction! We meticulously produce our extracts according to precise standards where each herb is extracted according to the distinct characteristic of each plant!
The highest quality California Poppy Glycerin based liquid extract made with love for plants and respect for Nature!

We strictly use Only Certified or ethically sourced wild harvested raw material, vegetable palm glycerin and crystal clear artesian purified water! Really the BEST California Poppy herbal glycerite on market!
brand: California Poppy Alcohol-Free Liquid Extract, Organic California Poppy (Eschscholzia Californica) Dried Above-Ground Part Glycerite 4 oz
