text: Tealyra is my favorite brand for all tea types on Amazon! I love to have this tea in the evening a few hours before bed.  It does not make you sleepy exactly, but is calming and soothing.  It is not an overpowering strong tea but has the perfect balance of mint and chamomile flavor.  I highly recommend it!
title: Great for bedtime
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
name: Tealyra - Bedtime - 25 Bags - Chamomile - Spearmint - Hemp Leaves - Unique Relaxing Herbal Loose Leaf Tea - Sleep and Calm Tea - All Natural - 25 Sachets
description: Rest easy with this soothing bedtime blend that will send you off to dreamland so quickly, you won't have time to count sheep! We have crafted this sleep-saving tonic with sweet chamomile, valerian, rose petals, lemongrass, spearmint and passion flower. Valerian is a sedative herb that has been used for centuries to aid those suffering with insomnia. Passionflower and hemp leaves are naturally calming; it will help ease your mind. Bedtime is a mild blend that promotes calm, sound sleep, and will help you to wake up feeling well-rested. We recommended that you drink this infusion before bedtime to increase the quality of your sleep.

text: I love this product.  I saw that some people didn’t find it effective and/or it didn’t taste great. I almost didn’t buy it but decided to give it a try. Now I drink it nightly to help me relax and drift off to sleep. I also take it with me traveling and it has been really helpful in that situation as well. I usually combine with another sleepytime tea from the supermarket that is chamomile vanilla. It’s part of my overall ritual of sleep hygiene including sleep music, a hot bath/shower and reading. It is a little pricey but well worth it in my opinion. I have tried chamomile tea alone and that is not as effective. You get what you pay for type of thing.
title: Helps me to relax and sleep

description: Rest easy with this soothing bedtime blend that will send you off to dreamland so quickly, you won't have time to count sheep! We have crafted this sleep-saving tonic with sweet chamomile, valerian, rose petals, lemongrass, spearmint and passion flower. Valerian is a sedative herb that has been used for centuries to aid those suffering with insomnia. Passionflower and hemp leaves are naturally calming; it will help ease your mind. Bedtime is a mild blend that promotes calm, sound sleep, and will help you to wake up feeling well-rested. We recommended that you drink this infusion before bedtime to increase the quality of your sleep.

text: I am a huge fan of Rishi. They source THE BEST from around the world. This chamomile brews THE MOST AMAZING and satisfying elixir. I noticed the Egyptian source was replaced with another region but the quality remains superb. Unfortunately, Amazon does not understand the care required to protect the dried whole flowers during delivery and they put it in a plastic sleeve without even the slightest cushion. The result was a badly crushed product. Rishi packs their direct orders properly so Amazon needs to catch up in this area Most people wouldn't care but if I wanted dust, I would have ordered it. I ordered whole flowers and now I have to put them in paper filters to prevent the crushed bits from ending up in my cup...I don't like the taste of paper, I'm spoiled, I know. I tried my microperforated filter but it wasn't enough. But it doesn't stop me from enjoying this Superior product. I just might order direct next time if Amazon can't correct their poor handling. I will say in Amazon's defense they made it right when I complained about my product showing up the way it did. Amazon always makes it right for me. You can't lose on Rishi either way.
title: Product amazing, Amazon shipping crushed it

text: I wanted to try loose leaf tea and bought this flavor to replace the prepackaged Honey Vanilla Chamomile I usually buy. But this is even better! Open opening the package, immediately you can smell the freshness of the leaves. As this was my first time using loose leaf tea, it was fun just gently inhaling the scent, taking a moment to identify and appreciate each of the ingredients.Usually I can't wait for the bags to steep but this time I gave the leaves the appropriate amount of time, the recommended 4 minutes, excited to experience each flavor. While my cup usually has a generous helping of sugar and milk, this time I only added a splash to cool it down, and a small teaspoon. It did not disappoint. The flavors came together beautifully, without the usual bitterness that requires all the sugar to make it enjoyable for me. This time, I actually enjoyed the flavor of the tea itself, savoring each sip.Not only was the sup itself wonderful, but the packaging is aesthetically pleasing. Tightly pressed so no air gets inside keeping leaves fresh.The seller also included a complimentary sample of another flavor. I anticipate getting at least 3 or 4 cups from the sample alone!I highly recommend this tea, this seller, and will definitely be purchasing again.Thank you so much!EDIT- Even though the bag doesnt look like much at first, it goes a long way!We've had this bag for 2 weeks now, and had probably 10 cups worth.  We haven't even gone through a quarter of it. We used to have to use two bags of the pre bagged tea for each cup, so even though there were 20 bags, we would only get 10 cups out of it, and it's about $5 at our local store. This loose leaf not only taste so much better but it you end up getting more bang for your buck!
title: The perfect cup!

text: I recently discovered the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea, and it has quickly become my go-to drink for a serene and cozy evening routine. This tea has truly transformed my bedtime experience, and I couldn't be more delighted with its comforting flavors and soothing effects.From the moment you open the package, the aromatic notes of caramel fill the air, instantly creating a sense of warmth and relaxation. The delightful scent alone sets the stage for a peaceful and tranquil evening.The taste of this tea is simply divine. The caramel flavor is perfectly balanced, not overpowering, and it adds a delightful touch of sweetness to each sip. It's like indulging in a guilt-free treat that helps me unwind after a long day.What makes the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea truly special is its blend of herbs and botanicals. Infused with chamomile, roasted dandelion, and licorice root, this blend works harmoniously to calm the mind and relax the body. With every sip, I can feel the stress and tension melt away, paving the way for a restful night's sleep.Another aspect I appreciate about this tea is its commitment to using high-quality, organic ingredients. As someone who values natural and wholesome products, it brings me peace of mind knowing that I am nourishing my body with a tea that is free from artificial additives and pesticides.The tea bags are individually wrapped, ensuring optimal freshness and convenience. I appreciate the thoughtfulness that goes into each detail of the packaging, making it easy to enjoy a cup of bliss whenever the mood strikes.Whether you're winding down after a hectic day or simply craving a moment of tranquility, the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea is a true indulgence for the senses. It has become an integral part of my evening ritual, helping me relax, unwind, and drift into a deep, rejuvenating sleep.If you're seeking a delicious and comforting tea that promotes serenity and restfulness, I wholeheartedly recommend the Yogi Bedtime Caramel Tea. Treat yourself to this delightful blend and discover the blissful sip of serenity it brings to your bedtime routine.

text: This is my second review;  I fixed a cup up and let it steep for ten minutes. I drank it at 10:00 PM.  It totally destresses/slows down your brain, relaxes your muscles and you fall asleep faster.  But getting up in the morning can be a challenge.  I had to take two naps the next day.  I'm in the over 65 age group and just had surgery so I am in recovery phase, but this was crazy.  I was actually wobbly on my feet!  I was groggy till 3:45 PM.  The next time I used it I REMOVED the tea bag after 3 minutes.  I was more alert the next morning.  You do have to pay attention to just how strong you want this tea.  Don't underestimate its power to work!  My daughter was sleepy to 3:30 the next day and her best friend said it knocked her out and she slept like a rock until nearly noon the next day. Here's the list of ingredients:Yogi Soothing Caramel Bedtime tea contains the following ingredients: Organic Chamomile Flower, Organic Rooibos Leaf**, Organic Roasted Chicory Root, Organic Skullcap Leaf, Organic Nutmeg Kernel, Organic Caramel Flavor, Organic Vanilla Flavor, Organic Cinnamon Bark, Organic Stevia Leaf, Organic Cardamom Pod, Organic California Poppy Plant, Organic Ginger Root, Organic Clove Bud, L-Theanine Suntheanine, Organic Black Pepper, Organic Cinnamon Bark Oil, Organic Cardamom Seed Oil, Organic Ginger Root Oil.

text: Somewhere I read that thyme tea might be beneficial for congestion and coughing spells.  I am asthmatic and get bouts of bronchial coughing spells that can be a nuisance and hard to control at times. My asthma is caused by inflammation to the airways and thyme is touted as possibly being beneficial for inflammation and soothing a throat irritated by coughing. So, hey, anything that might help I'll at least give it a try.  It does have a pleasant herbal taste, at least in my opinion, and is soothing on my throat. Since it is an herbal tea I can drink it anytime of day or even in the evening and not have to worry about caffeine disturbing my sleep. I can usually get two cups of tea from one teabag so for my personal use it lasts me awhile. I purchased this thyme tea online because I could not find it in any of my local stores. I would purchase it again as it would be good for allergy season as well when I get the sneezing and coughing spells from allergen irritants. Plus it just makes a nice warm soothing nightcap too.I have low blood pressure and am not on medication so I don't worry too much about  the thyme tea raising my blood pressure but those on blood pressure medication might want to take caution. Always, check with your doctor first when in doubt even about herbal products as sometimes they can interfere with prescription meds.
title: Pleasant Herbal Taste & Good for Inflammatory Coughing Caused by Asthma

text: This tea worked miracles for me.  I am not exaggerating one bit.I'm 71 years old with lots of allergies - to foods and environmental vegetation.In July there was a huge wildfire in the mountains near us.  I felt like I was hit with a ton of bricks.  The wildfire smoke wreaked havoc on my body.  My face swelled up badly.  I had difficulty breathing.  My blood pressure went up 21 points and stayed that way for 6 weeks.  I went to my primary care doctor and urgent care during this time.  I was a mess.Then I learned that the fine particulate matter from wildfire smoke settles in the lungs, gets into the bloodstream and can cross the blood-brain barrier.  I was on high doses of prednisone for 6 weeks.  I didn't get better.I finally learned that thyme tea is an anti-inflammatory. So, I bought some from Amazon.  I flavored it with cinnamon, ginger, a pinch of cloves and a little honey.  It tasted good.  After just half a cup, I started to feel better - finally.  After an hour, I was starting to feel 'healthy'.Now, after 3 days, my neighbors and friends are telling me that the swelling on my face is getting better.  When it's so noticeable that even casual neighbors are noticing the difference, you know something good is happening.  And, I just checked my blood pressure.  It's down by 15 points.This tea is really healing me.  And, a friend who is a chef dropped by and I asked him to taste the tea.  After 3 sips, he said that the tightness he had in his chest went away.  I wasn't even aware that he was having chest problems.  He said he hasn't been bothered by asthma in a long time, but that day his chest felt tight.  The tea helped him to feel better.These are true stories.  Take it for what you will.  I just know that I'm happy with the effects this tea has had on my health.

features: North American Wildflower - This remarkable poppy, native to California, is both drought and heat tolerant. Mikado California Poppy flowers thrive as perennials in warm climates or as annuals in frost-prone areas.
Scarlet Blooms - Saucer shaped flowers have four petals and put on quite a show, especially when planted in mass. They open and close at nighttime or on a cloudy day.

Sustainable Living - Adding California poppy plants into your gardening benefits the local ecosystem and improves garden health. They add beauty to your space and are resilient North American widlflowers, native to the California region. The blooms also can provide needed habitat, pollen, and nectar for beneficial insects, promoting biodiversity in your garden.

The Info You Need to Grow - These non-perishable seeds are packed in a beautiful paper packet with instructions for successful growing and germination in your home garden. text: I really wanted this to be a warming, soothing, silky latte. Unfortunately, it isn't.I love my turmeric and ashwagandha, I think they work wonders and I've taken them in various forms. I also love black pepper and have it on all my dinnersThis latte is just undrinkable, I have no idea why it's has as many stars as it does. I've just followed the instructions and sat down to what I thought would be a soothing warm cuppa only to have the roof of my mouth taken off by the sheer black pepper content. text: I love the choice of ingredients and the fact that it’s certified organic too. It’s fairly easy to take (2 dropperfuls once to three times a day) but it’s hard for me to get a “full” dropper.  It fills up about 3/4 of the way no matter how I angle the bottle and position the dropper.  And there’s no line or indicator to show how full it needs to be.  However, since they say you can take it up to 3x a day I guess you don’t have to be too cautious about overdosing.  The taste is also a little strong for me personally — the thyme really is prominent in this.  I am used to herbal supplements and normally don’t have any issues with weird concoctions but with this one I’d have to get used to it.  I was able to do one dropper of it without mixing into anything but I think I’ll try hiding it in a tart juice, but it’s such a strange combination of flavors I’m not sure I could stand drinking it in a full cup of juice.  In a pinch I would use this but I think I’d prefer a pill or just a simple elderberry gummy instead.  Just my preference anyway.  Otherwise the product itself is clean and seems to be an excellent way to boost your immune system when necessary.

text: This item is a 30ml amber bottle of organic herb tincture that is plant based and formulated to provide immunity support. The bottle includes an eye dropper cap that is used to deliver the recommended 2 dropper full of the liquid. The ingredients includes extracts of echinacea, elderberry, thyme, sage, yarrow, and lemon balm in a proprietary combination. The claim is that this tincture will support a healthy immune system and provide a defense against seasonal threats that can make you ill, per the product description. I'm familiar with all the ingredients, but feel that there are minerals and vitamins that should be added to the mix to boost immunity. The liquid tastes quite bad so I recommend adding the 2 dropper full to some juice. I appreciate that it's made in the USA. I find the price point for 20 days supply to be rather steep. Overall, it's not a bad tincture to add to your daily supplement regiment, but it's not something I will continue to use given I have other more cost effective immunity support supplements.
